newsitem.title: USA: AA Cargo sees solid start to 97.
newsitem.headline: AA Cargo sees solid start to 97.

text.p: American Airlines Cargo is enjoying a solid first month of 1997 on major international corridors and is even ahead of its traffic targets for January, the carrier's U.S. vice-president of U.S. cargo sales, Mark Najarian, said.
"Right since the first of the year our loads have been very, very good, and I really don't see any slowdown occurring," he told Reuters in a telephone interview.
"Nobody is talking about things slowing down...and forwarders seem to be bullish and so do lots of the shippers. In particular, Tokyo, weak the last few years, is doing very well," he said.

"Through our system, we are above what we forecast for January, and I don't see that changing very much. The first quarter of 1996 was a record first quarter and despite some capacity cuts in some areas, we are at the same pace, at least trafficwise," he said.
Najarian would not comment on Thursday's announcement by Deutsche Lufthansa of global rate increases ranging from 7-10 percent, effective in most cases on March 1.
He said it was American's policy not to speculate publicly about rate changes.
